turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about JetBlue Park at Fenway South.
turn.1: What is the theme of the park?
turn.2: The wavy design of the roof resembles the Cypress trees in the surrounding area of the ballpark.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In addition, the blocks that make up the ballpark are embedded with sea shells from nearby Sanibel Island.
turn.5: Is there anything else unique about the park?
turn.6: The park also features a lawn in right field, a popular feature in spring training parks.
turn.7: Did the park have any other features?
turn.8: The ballpark's design is also LEED Certified.
turn.9: What is the Player Development Complex?
turn.10: In addition to the ballpark where spring training games are played there is also a state of the art player development complex.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is interesting?
turn.12: Unlike the old spring training ball park, JetBlue Park is located on the same piece of land as the player development complex.
